meanings.definition: A group of sheaves of grain stood on end in a field to dry.
meanings.sent1: The farmer gathered the stooks of wheat to let them dry in the sun.
meanings.sent2: In the autumn, the golden stooks dotted the vast field, ready for harvesting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the stooks were a fun maze to explore.
meanings.sent4: The stooks in the field stood like soldiers at attention, waiting for the harvest.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the stooks against the blue sky was a picture of rural beauty.

meanings.definition: To arrange (sheaves of grain) in stooks.
meanings.sent1: The farmers stooks the wheat carefully to ensure proper drying.
meanings.sent2: They stooks the barley neatly in rows to make the harvesting easier.
meanings.sent3: As a joke, the farmer decided to stooks the sheaves in a heart shape.
meanings.sent4: The workers stooks the hay like a skilled artist creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: She watched her father stooks the grain, learning the traditional farming method.
